alert.note: Alert for Latimer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 10:45PM CST until March 03 at 12:45AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Choctaw, Latimer, Le Flore and Pushmataha. * WHEN...Until 645 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1042 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated areas of light rain continue and are expected to expand in coverage overnight. Automated rain gauges and radar data indicated heavy rain from earlier thunderstorms with rainfall amounts of 1 to 4 inches. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Poteau... Hugo... Wilburton... Antlers... Clayton... Heavener... Talihina... Wister... Howe... Boswell... Red Oak... Fort Towson... Fanshawe... Sawyer... Rattan... Soper... Albion... Nashoba... Clayton Lake State Park... Tuskahoma... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
